page.title: 05PRIMARY EDUCATION,DUNVANT
page.content: The school is named Dyfnant Primary School,Dyfnant being the Welsh word for Dunvant.Opened in 1972 to accommodate 240 children,a demountable classroom had to be added when the number of children rose to 270.A gradual decline in numbers enabled a nursery class to be established. Although on the fringe of Swansea's suburbia,the building is on an enviable,elevated site enjoying rural surroundings with a view down Clyne Valley towards Swansea Bay.The grounds are extensive and the children have a playground,games field,as well as other extensive grassed areas for play or study. The School is supported by a very active Parents' Association which has supplied many items of equipment as a result of fund-raising activities.
